comment.author: 92807080@N00
comment._content:
The weapon in the image is a Rifle Number I, Mark III, Short Magazine Lee Enfield (SMLE) modified with a remote trigger and prism mirror sight to allow the shooter to use the existing iron sights and not expose the head above the parapet.  All armies used a variation on this theme in the trenches themselves, though designated marksmen and actual snipers moved further back to "hides" and used telescopic sights beginning in 1915. 
.
